definition: thick stems and broad leaves (idiom)/boorish/rough and ready/sloppy
coarse/rough/thick (for cylindrical objects)/unfinished/vulgar/rude/crude
branch/classifier for sticks, rods, pencils etc
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
leaf/page/lobe/(historical) period/classifier for small boats
surname Ye

sentences.chinese: 這樣粗枝大葉是行不通的。

sentences.english: He will blame you for carelessness.
sentences.chinese: 他會責備你的粗枝大葉。

sentences.english: You can chalk up his mistake to carelessness.
sentences.chinese: 你可以把他的錯誤歸因於粗枝大葉。

sentences.english: To be crude and careless is an extremely bad style of work.
sentences.chinese: 粗枝大葉是一種極壞的作風。

sentences.english: To do her justice, she was never careless in her work.
sentences.chinese: 說句公道話，她做工作從不粗枝大葉。

sentences.english: She complained about her husband's carelessness.
sentences.chinese: 她抱怨說她丈夫粗枝大葉。

sentences.english: Bill was often called down by his teacher for doing homework carelessly.
sentences.chinese: 比爾常常由於做作業粗枝大葉而受到老師的申斥。

sentences.english: We can't do with such carelessness .
sentences.chinese: 我們不能容忍這種粗枝大葉的作風。
我們不能容忍這種粗枝大葉的作風。

sentences.english: His carelessness resulted in a serious accident.
sentences.chinese: 他的粗枝大葉導致了一場重大事故。

sentences.english: She complained of his carelessness.; She complained that he was careless.
I thought shame to be so careless.
sentences.chinese: 我因爲這樣粗枝大葉而感到慚愧。

sentences.english: Sloppy routines rob teachers of precious instruction time.
sentences.chinese: 粗枝大葉的工作計劃會浪費教師寶貴的教學時間。

sentences.english: His carelessness results in a serious blunder.
sentences.chinese: 他的粗枝大葉導致他犯了一個嚴重錯誤。
他是個粗枝大葉的浪蕩子。

definition: lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
magnanimous
to tease/to poke fun at
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to feel embarrassed/to feel akward
idle gossip
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
as to/considering/for
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
affectionate/an affectionate person
